physical_appearance:This is a red sewing box that contains a set of six smaller boxes of purl thread
 sequins
 ribbons and beads and a small coil of wire. The sewing box is circular in shape
 as are the smaller boxes containing the dewing materials. Five of the smaller boxes are of the same size
 with the box in the middle being much smaller in size than the rest.

sgcool_label_text:This red sewing box contains 6 smaller boxes of purl thread
 sequins
 ribbons and beads
 and a small coil of wire. Purls
 sequins
 ribbons and beads were used in Nyonya needlework to achieve effects of colour
 light and contrasting textures. Labels on some of the boxes remain intact. The label on the box which contains metal purl shows: ‘Made in France by Roland. Trademark Favier Brothers Lyons…’ 
 ‘Boite modele depose’
 and ‘Pattern 2175 Frisée Brillante-Br.3’.\r\n\r\nPurl thread was known as gim kasar and giem kembang
 where gim means gold. Sequins are flat discs that were secured using beads or metal purl.

metadata.title_text: Sewing box with purl, sequins, beads
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a red sewing box that contains a set of six smaller boxes of purl thread, sequins, ribbons and beads and a small coil of wire. The sewing box is circular in shape, as are the smaller boxes containing the dewing materials. Five of the smaller boxes are of the same size, with the box in the middle being much smaller in size than the rest.
metadata.subject_terms_1: Peranakan sewing tools tailors beads (pierced objects) sequins (spangles) wire needlework (visual works)
metadata.subject_terms_2: Sewing Equipment and supplies Peranakan (Asian people) Beads Tailors Clothing trade Needlework
metadata.subject_terms_3: Vanishing trade Textile art and design
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This red sewing box contains 6 smaller boxes of purl thread, sequins, ribbons and beads, and a small coil of wire. Purls, sequins, ribbons and beads were used in Nyonya needlework to achieve effects of colour, light and contrasting textures. Labels on some of the boxes remain intact. The label on the box which contains metal purl shows: ‘Made in France by Roland. Trademark Favier Brothers Lyons…’ , ‘Boite modele depose’, and ‘Pattern 2175 Frisée Brillante-Br.3’.

Purl thread was known as gim kasar and giem kembang, where gim means gold. Sequins are flat discs that were secured using beads or metal purl.
